thread.title: Bayhawks to name former Terp Brian Reese as head coach
thread.title_full: Bayhawks to name former Terp Brian Reese as head coach

author: Bill Wagner
title: Bayhawks to name former Terp Brian Reese as head coach
text:
Bayhawks to name former Terp Brian Reese as head coach Boston Cannons v Chesapeake Bayhawks Mitchell Layton / Getty Images Assistant coach Brian Reese of the Chesapeake Bayhawks looks on before a MLL Lacrosse game against the Boston Cannons at Navy-Marine Corps Memorial Stadium on July 16, 2015. Reese is expected to be named head coach on Tuesday. Assistant coach Brian Reese of the Chesapeake Bayhawks looks on before a MLL Lacrosse game against the Boston Cannons at Navy-Marine Corps Memorial Stadium on July 16, 2015. Reese is expected to be named head coach on Tuesday. (Mitchell Layton / Getty Images) Bill Wagner Contact Reporter bwagner@capgaznews.com 
The Chesapeake Bayhawks of Major League Lacrosse have promoted Brian Reese to head coach, The Capital has learned. 
Multiple sources confirmed the hiring of Reese to succeed Dave Cottle, who retired from coaching following the 2015 season. 
Reese could not be reached for comment. 
Cottle, who remains with the Bayhawks as team president, admitted that Chesapeake had hired a head coach when contacted on Monday night. However, Cottle would neither confirm nor deny that Reese was the selection and said an official announcement would be made on Tuesday morning. 
"We believe we have found an ideal individual to lead the Bayhawks into the future," Cottle said. 
Reese joined the Bayhawks in 2011 as an assistant coach and defensive coordinator. He has a previous history with the organization, having played for the Bayhawks for four of his five seasons in Major League Lacrosse and later serving as general manager in 2011.
